metadata.synopsis: After a comet causes a radiation storm on Earth, machines come to life and turn against their makers. Holed up in a North Carolina truck stop, a group of survivors must fend for themselves against a mass of homicidal trucks. A diner cook, Bill Robinson (Emilio Estevez), emerges as the unlikely leader of the pack, attempting to find an escape plan for himself and the survivors, who include his boss, Bubba Hendershot (Pat Hingle), and a newlywed couple.

reviews: Maximum Overdrive is minimum movie-making by no less a celebrity than best-selling horror writer Stephen King, here making his less-than-auspicious directorial debut.
Stephen King has admitted himself that he was coked out of his mind during the making of this. Well... duh!
Truck stop attacked by mechanical objects, including trucks, gone awry! Based on Stephen King story.
This is why other people usually direct King's writing.
Maximum Crap. It sorta revived AC/DC, if that matters.
Most of the characters are so annoying that you want them to die ... a recipe' for a railroad-spike lobotomy migraine
A suitably schlocky Stephen King story.
